intro: Stegnogramma sagittifolia, commonly known as the arrowleaf stegnogramma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its lanceolate, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woods. Stegnogramma sagittifolia is often found in wetland habitats and is considered a rare species in its native range.
